job_title: Devops Engineer in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Fully remote work, no business trips required
cons: Relatively low salary for this kind of job

job_title: Research Associate in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Modern university with good academic and research culture
cons: Natural sciences buildings are located on the outskirts of the city

review_title: Working as assistant in Modeling / Simulation
job_title: Studentische Hilfskraft in der Forschung in Frankfurt am Main
pros: International team that was distributed worldwide. Because nobody barely checked if you did any work, you could do nothing and still get paid.
cons: The building was old, there was not enough office space for everybody, many computers were more than 8 years old and there was barely any team work.

job_title: Wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter, in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Fair salary, many hours, demanding
cons: No inflation adjustment, weak workers rights representation

review_title: Decent pay for a PhD in the humanities
job_title: Doctoral Researcher in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Better than many PhD positions — 30 vacation days, public health insurance, and access to many of the university resources for employees and students.
cons: University is not particularly accessible for non-German speaking students and employees. All official communication is done in German, although no German knowledge is mentioned in the job requirements.

review_title: Good atmosphere and dynamic research team
job_title: Post Doctoral Researcher in Frankfurt am Main
pros:
- Work environment 
- Research seminars
- International services
cons:
- Small department 
- Lack of internationalization of some (but not all) departments

job_title: Assistant Professor in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Good integration of new employees
cons: Helps to be fluent in German despite being an international Uni

job_title: Post Doctoral Fellow in Frankfurt am Main
pros: it is good to work here
cons: No big cons in my mind

pros: Payment for the job and appreciation
cons: Remite work and team building

pros: friendly atmosphere, more training opportunities
cons: feels underpaid like any PhD in the world

job_title: Postdoctoral Researcher in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Comes with benefits of being a public sector employee in Germany
cons: Long working hours with little scope of professional development outside academia

job_title: Scientific Researcher in Frankfurt am Main

pros: Good work life balance with sufficient vacation days.

review_title: nice city but it is expensive
job_title: PhD Student in Frankfurt am Main
pros: If you like the medicine industry, highly recommended to join the university

job_title: Junior Software Developer in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Big city, nice environment, huge park
cons: Old campus, old library, problems with visa

job_title: HiWI Job in Frankfurt am Main
pros: you will get strict training if you want to study Ph.D in the future
cons: too demanding for work for a student

job_title: Wissenschaftliche Mitarbeiterin in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Interesting job, smart and innovative people, good and flexible work environment.
cons: Short term projects, otherwise good.

review_title: Great teaching and research, however sometimes poorly organized
job_title: Graduate Student in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Very interesting classes and approachable faculty
cons: It can take forever to receive your grades and the ratio of students per faculty is very high

job_title: PhD Researcher in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Well organised, good facilities and hessen travel ticket
cons: No bonus' or incentives provided for employees

job_title: Academic Tutor in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Have always been happy working for them. You can plan your time almost freely.
cons: No cons with this employer.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Good education and fine job oppotunities
cons: Long duration (6y, 3m), hard to get

job_title: Wissenschaftliche/r Mitarbeiter/in in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Very good work-life balance, friendly working atmosphere and colleagues, exciting projects.
cons: Limited long term career perspektive.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Good management and nice stuff
cons: Really hard to balance work and personal life

job_title: Intern in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Nice team of colleagues and managers
cons: Working hours vary based on semester dates

job_title: Wiss MA in Frankfurt am Main
pros: student aid, was really a good job
cons: pay could have been a bit better

job_title: PhD Student in Frankfurt am Main
pros: nice, English environment, enough payment.
cons: the things in market are in German

job_title: Research Assistant in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Flexible working hours and home office/remote work
cons: Few positions for large applicant pool

job_title: Quantitative Researcher in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Lots of support from academics scholars
cons: Administrative and IT support are weak

job_title: Research Associate in Frankfurt am Main
pros:
- A number of great researchers
- Most people are truly friendly and open-minded
- Many great lectures and seminars from visiting researchers
- Campus Riedberg has a descent appearance
- The Goethe Graduate Academy is excellent for soft skill training and free for PhD students and postdocs
- The workgroups are mostly independent
- The Frankfurt area has a high recreational value
cons:
- As in academia in general: low salary, horrific work-life balance, questionable career support
- Prices for student benefits are strongly increasing
- Business hours of canteens are restricted during semester breaks
- Some work groups stew too much in their own stew
- Parts of the basic infrastructure are in a bad shape

review_title: I worked as a student assistant for a bit over a year
job_title: Student Assistant in Frankfurt am Main
pros:
Flexible hours
Fair compensation
Humane treatment
Light work
Great environment and facilities
cons: Working as a student assistant could be a bit stressful, depending on the professor you're working for. Some tend to be all over the place and provide little explanation of what they wand, but nevertheless are demanding with the time of delivery of what they want

review_title: Very international, socially active,  better for social sciences, has little funding for medical research
job_title: PhD Student in Frankfurt am Main
pros: University and the state try to help researchers financially like providing Landesticket for free transport
cons: Frankfurt is a very expensive city, and the researcher salaries cannot compete with the rest of the population in terms of finding an apartment etc. Also, the budget spared for medical and life sciences are considerably small compared to some other important universities in these fields.

review_title: Best place to do a finance Phd in Germany
job_title: Research Assistant in Frankfurt am Main
pros:
- Good pay given that you're doing a Phd during that time
- a few very good researchers
- great Westend campus
- great, not-too-big city offering a lot of cultural activities, social life, nightlife
cons:
- not all of your colleague researchers are going to be "top"
- inequal distribution of work among assistants can be frustrating
- a lot of bureaucracy

review_title: Nice place for PhD studies - if you are not into money
job_title: PhD Student/Scientific Employee in Frankfurt am Main
pros: well equipped facilities, interdisciplinary cooperations, nice colleagues, interesting topics
cons: payment may vary between 50% to 75% of E13 TVGU, even if everyone works 10-12 hours a day, causing inequalities in the team

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Frankfurt (Oder)
pros:
Very nice environment and a beautiful campus,
all in all a good palce to work
cons: can be bureacratic sometimes (however HR tries everything in order too keep bueacracy at low)

review_title: An Master of Science Quantitative Economics student
job_title: MSQ Economics Student in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Strong at finance and Macroeconomics. Well reputed and contains prominent professors. The campus is physically in very good condition.
cons: Reputation comes after universities such as Mannheim, LMU, and Humboldt.

job_title: Wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Riedberg-Campus from Goethe University is one of the leading facilities for biophysical research and magnetic resonance in biologial systems in europe.
cons: Undergraduate teaching is on an average level

job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Frankfurt am Main
pros: good colleagues, supportive manager, good pay, good benefits.
cons: non-permanent contract, no possibility of continuing in the university.

job_title: Biologisch- technische Assistentin in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Discount with insurances, job ticket, privat pension
cons: Not really a chance to get promoted

pros:
Good research projects and relaxed environment

cons:
Short contracts
Low salaries and benefits
Less interaction between clinicians and scientists
Some arrogant doctors

pros: It's a friendly space for research
